task.title: Creating a Form
task.abstract: The Forms object provides staff users with the ability to build and publish responsive HTML5 web forms to the Community Portal. Forms are used to gather more information on attendees to customize the event experience, provide feedback to an organization, and detail the level of user engagement.

step.cmd: Navigate to the Forms tab in the Form Builder app and click the New button.

step.info: Optionally, enter a form Description and any necessary User Instructions.

step.cmd: Select the Display Style using the picklist and click Save.

choices.choice: Standard- Renders the entire form as one continuous page. Selected by default.
Accordian- Renders the form in collapsible sections. Each section is equal to one Field Group.
Wizard- Renders the form with tabs for separate sections. Each tab is equal to one Field Group.

step.cmd: Click the Form Builder button and then click the New Field Group button to add a Field Group.
Populate the Field Group Name with the form's section heading and provide any Instructions and click Save.
step.info: If the Field Group Name is left blank, the system will automatically insert the Field Group ID number as the name.

step.cmd: After saving the Field Group, click the New Field button and enter the Field Label.
step.info: The Field Label displays as the question or statement that attendees are asked to evaluate. Select the Is Required checkbox to ensure attendees provide a response.

step.cmd: Select a value or option from the Type picklist.
step.info: The system will validate field contents prior to submission. For example, when the Type is set to Email, a validation error will occur if the entered form response is not in the format of a valid email.
The Type restricts the options available for linking to fields of the related object.
If the Type is a single or multi-select picklist and is not linked to a field on the related object, enter the available Options.

If the Type is a single or multi-select picklist and is mapped to a field on the related object, then Options will autopopulate. Next, select the Database Operation on the field and click the Save button.

step.cmd: Click the Preview button to return the newly created form from the viewpoint of a Community Portal user.

taskbody.result:
The form is ready to be added to any item.
Staff users can reorder Field Groups, or the fields within a Field Group, through drag-and-drop.
